intro: Lisianthius nigrescens var. cuspidatus, commonly known as the black lisianthium, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in wet forest habitats and is often found at high elevations. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
